intro: Polypsecadium harmsianum, commonly known as the Cape fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. The flowers are pollinated primarily by birds, particularly sunbirds, which are attracted to their nectar-rich blooms.
